description: Wormwood (Artemisia capillaris) is an amazing plant species with a history as rich as its medicinal properties. Its pungent aroma makes it attractive to pollinators like butterflies, bees, and other insects. Its unique shape, with its multiple branching stems, creates an interesting silhouette, and its light green foliage set against its white flowers is a beautiful sight. Not only that, it is known for its medicinal properties, including anti-inflammatory, antifungal, and antiviral effects. Furthermore, it is also used as a flavoring in alcoholic drinks, and essential oils from wormwood have a number of uses in aromatherapy. All in all, it is a versatile and attractive species that can be used to its fullest potential.
